word_mean: 停顿：活动或运动暂停而造成的静止状态，如心跳暂停

sentence.Network_en: Argentina came to a virtual standstill while the game was being played.
sentence.Network_cn: 在比赛进行的时候，阿根廷全国几乎陷入了停顿状态。

sentence.Network_en: Investigations have ground to a standstill because no witnesses have come forward.
sentence.Network_cn: 调查陷入停滞，因为没有证人站出来。

sentence.Network_en: Normal life is at a standstill, and the economy is faltering.
sentence.Network_cn: 正常生活陷于瘫痪，经济止步不前。

entry.def: If movement or activity comes to or is brought to a standstill, it stops completely.

example.ex: Abruptly the group ahead of us came to a standstill...
example.tran: 我们前面的小组突然停了下来。

example.ex: Production is more or less at a standstill.
example.tran: 生产几乎处于停顿状态。

means.word_mean: 1. a situation in which no progress can be made or no advancement is possible;

auth_sentence.content: Voter Magdi says the economy is at a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content: Voter Magdi says the economy is at a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Voter Magdi says the economy is at a standstill.

auth_sentence.content: Basically, the country would come to a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content: Basically, the country would come to a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Basically, the country would come to a standstill.

auth_sentence.content: But many important sectors were at a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content: But many important sectors were at a standstill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But many important sectors were at a standstill.

sentences.en: She brought the car to a standstill.
